docs.lead_paragraph: Last year, Pakistan’s 51 cases of wild poliovirus represented the bulk of all 70 cases reported in the world. This year just might see the disease vanquished there.

headline.main: In Pakistan, a Final Push to Wipe Out Polio
headline.print_headline: In Pakistan, a Final Push Against Polio

docs.snippet: Last year, Pakistan’s 51 cases of wild poliovirus represented the bulk of all 70 cases reported in the world. This year just might see the disease vanquished there.

docs.lead_paragraph: The guidelines, though seen as imperfect, offer a way to proceed with worried patients who have recently lived in or traveled to an area where the mosquito-borne virus is being transmitted.

headline.main: C.D.C. Urges Zika Testing for Some Who Are Pregnant
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Urges Zika Testing for Some Who Are Pregnant

docs.abstract: Federal officials advise pregnant women who have visited foreign countries affected by mosquito-borne Zika virus and who feel unwell to be tested for infection, despite flaws in testing.
docs.snippet: The guidelines, though seen as imperfect, offer a way to proceed with worried patients who have recently lived in or traveled to an area where the mosquito-borne virus is being transmitted.

headline.main: Using Phones to Connect Children to Health Care

docs.abstract: Researchers and medical providers are looking at ways of better reaching children by cellphone to improve health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. advisory for pregnant women to avoid more than a dozen Latin American countries comes only a few months before the start of the Olympic Games in Brazil.

headline.main: Zika Warning Spotlights Latin America’s Fight Against Mosquito-Borne Diseases

docs.abstract: Brazil and other Latin American countries are struggling to contain surge in mosquito-borne diseases, including Zika, virus that causes infant brain damage; Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warning against travel to region has prompted pushback from some authorities and applause from others who welcome international attention to plight.
docs.snippet: The C.D.C. advisory for pregnant women to avoid more than a dozen Latin American countries comes only a few months before the start of the Olympic Games in Brazil.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Michael Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Elisabeth Malkin from Mexico City.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rival factions yelling at one another amid angry pushing. Tirades about condoms, and claims of misinformation. A parent declaring that children are being force-fed course material "straight from the pits of hell."

docs.lead_paragraph: The announcement came after a recent chain of cases in Liberia was snuffed out, ending an epidemic that killed more than 11,300 people, mostly in West Africa.

headline.main: Deadliest Ebola Outbreak on Record Is Over, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: Worst Ebola Outbreak Is Over After Two Years, W.H.O. Says

docs.abstract: World Health Organization announces end to world's deadliest-ever Ebola outbreak; officials express confidence about handling future outbreaks, while stressing need for continued vigilance and more international investment in preventing recurrence of disease which killed over 11,300 people in West Africa;
docs.snippet: The announcement came after a recent chain of cases in Liberia was snuffed out, ending an epidemic that killed more than 11,300 people, mostly in West Africa.

byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva and Clair MacDougall from Monrovia, Liberia. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, and Sheri Fink from New York.
